Alignment¶

class src.alignment.Alignment(num, score, query, template)[source]¶
class Alignment¶

This class groups informations about an alignment.

num¶

Number of the alignment

Type:int
score¶

Score of the alignment

query¶

Instance of a Query object as Query(query_residues, query_first, query_last)

template¶

Instance of a Template object as Template(template_name, template_residues)

calculate_modeller_score(res_path)[source]¶
  • This function constructs a single comparative model for the query sequence from the known template structure, using alignment.ali, a PIR format alignment of query and template. The final model is written into the PDB file.
  • This function also returns the DOPE assessed score of the model generated by MODELLER. DOPE is the most reliable score at separating native-like models from decoys (lower, i.e, more negative, DOPE scores tend to correlate with more native-like models).
Parameters:res_path (str) – Path to the results folder
Returns:The DOPE score of the model generated by MODELLER.
Return type:float
calculate_physics_score()[source]¶

Calculate a physics-based score using the BLOSSUM62 matrix. This matrix contains substitution scores for each amino acid pair. A positive score is given to the more likely substitutions while a negative score is given to the less likely substitutions.

Returns:The physics-based score calculated.
Return type:int
calculate_threading_score(dist_range, gap_penalty, dope_dict)[source]¶

Calculate the threading score of the query on the template sequence. 1) For each pair residues of the query sequence the distance between them is calculated using the coordinates of the template sequence.The distance calculation is optimized. 2) The calculated distance is then convert into a dope energy value. 3) All elements of the energy matrix generated are finally sum.

Parameters:
  • dist_range (list of int) – Range of distances in angströms. Distances within this range only are taken into account
  • gap_penalty (int) – Gap penalty
  • dope_dict (dictionary) – A dictionary with key = res_1-res_2 and value = an array of 30 dope energy values.
Returns:

The threading score calculated. Sum of the energy matrix.
Return type:

float
write_alignment_for_modeller(res_path)[source]¶

Modeller requires a specifically formatted alignment file “.ali”, following the PIR type format. This function writes this .ali file for the current alignment between the query and the template.

Example of an alignment.ali file for Modeller: >P1;5fd1 structureX:5fd1:1:A:106:A:ferredoxin:Azotobacter vinelandii:1.90: 0.19 AFVVTDNCIKCKYTDCVEVCPVDCFYEGPNFLVIHPDECIDCALCEPECPAQAIFSEDEVPEDMQEFIQLNAELA EVWPNITEKKDPLPDAEDWDGVKGKLQHLER*

>P1;1fdx sequence:1fdx:1::54::ferredoxin:Peptococcus aerogenes:2.00:-1.00 AYVINDSC–IACGACKPECPVNIIQGS–IYAIDADSCIDCGSCASVCPVGAPNPED—————– ——————————-*

write_pdb(pdb_path)[source]¶

Write a pdb file by threading the query sequence on the template CA coordinates.

Parameters:pdb_path (str) – Path of the pdb file to create.
src.alignment.process(dist_range, gap_penality, dope_dict, ali)[source]¶

Generates the threading and the physics-based scores for a given Alignment object.

Returns:
(Sum of the different scores, Number of the Alignment,
Template’s name, Template’s benchmark)
Return type:tupple
